file_content.text: My family and I owe you a great debt, Lieutenant. Thank you.
Thank you for... for saving my family, Lieutenant. You have honored our agreement.
I have nothing to say to the likes of you.
Our arrangement is complete. Please leave me with my family.
Listen closely, soldier. Gearbox is working inside a highly secure bunker, hidden in the mountains.
A direct assault is impossible--the bunker's force fields are impenetrable. But if you raid the generator facility that powers it, you should be able to shut the defenses down.
Nothing is impossible for Havoc Squad.
No problem.
I suppose we'll soon find out for sure.
I need specifics.
The generator facility powers all of the bunker's outer defenses. It's well hidden, but I can provide you with its exact coordinates.
Impenetrable? Come on.
I haven't led you astray thus far. I have no reason to begin now.
As for Gearbox himself, I cannot offer any further information. His "Project B" was kept a secret even from House Thul's highest noblemen.
However, he promised that Project B would singlehandedly turn the tide of the conflict. Whatever it is, Project B is dangerous.
I'll be careful.
I'm here for Gearbox, not his work.
Project B isn't my objective.
But if Project B is a weapon, Gearbox may attempt to use it against you. I thought you should be warned.
You'd better not be holding out on me, Markus.
You don't know? Convenient.
I've told you all I know. The rest is up to you.
Our arrangement is concluded. If you'll excuse us, I'd like to spend some time alone with my family, now.
Markus!
Father! We're so happy to see you!
Altana, Valyn. I'm sorry to have put you through all of this. Was your journey a safe one? Are you injured?
We are uninjured, husband. This beast you sent for us was more savage than those we encountered along the way.
It really was the most exciting adventure of our lives, Father--thank you!
Your wife and daughter are safe, Markus--now it's your turn.
I did what you asked.
Enjoyed yourself, huh?
Oh, yes, it was utterly thrilling. Thank you!
I did all of the work. You should be thanking me.
What are you thanking him for?
Yes, but father is the one who sent you! He truly is the most wonderful father in all the galaxy.
You have carried out your end of the agreement. With Altana and Valyn safe, I can tell you everything you wish to know.
Markus!
Our house is no longer ours, dear. It is a puppet, and nothing more. The two of you are my only concern now.
Until I see my wife and daughter safe, we have nothing further to discuss.
I have now proven the accuracy of my knowledge, as well as my intentions. Before I share any more intelligence on Gearbox, you must rescue my wife and daughter.
I'll rescue your family. Where are they?
All right.
Nobody gets rescued until I know what Gearbox is up to with Project B.
Tell me about Project B first.
Tell me where Gearbox is!
I want Gearbox! [Hit Markus.]
Have I... not made myself clear?
I have stated the price of further intelligence. Until you rescue my wife and daughter, we have nothing further to discuss.
I'll rescue your wife and daughter. Where can I find them?
Fine.
What am I supposed to do, bring them here?
You must be joking.
Absolutely. I must see firsthand that they are unharmed.
Stop wasting my time! [Hit Markus.]
This... this gains you nothing. I will not yield.
My wife and daughter can be found at our family manor. I'll provide you with the coordinates.
They must not be recognized while traveling with you. You'll need to acquire disguises of some kind.
I'll see if Captain Cormac has anything I can use.
Understood.
I'll dress them both up in matching slave girl dancer outfits, no problem.
What is this, a costume party?
I think you may find more success using disguises that actually disguise their features.
I don't plan on leaving any witnesses.
No one will see us together.
I don't doubt your skills, but I won't have anything left to chance. You must disguise them somehow.
Is there anything else you want, as long as you're dreaming?
This is ridiculous.
My family and I have a code word for situations such as this. Speaking it will prove that you are acting on my behalf.
"Tyrovan." Remember the word well. I'll not have you harming Altana or Valyn to gain their cooperation when you could simply speak a word.
"Tyrovan"--got it.
Very well.
Good.
Those are their names?
Altana and Valyn?
Correct. Altana is my wife, and Valyn, my daughter.
That's not up to you.
If you fail to deliver Altana and Valyn to me, alive and well, I will never tell you anything. Never.
Now go. We will only speak further when I see my wife and daughter safely before me.
You've returned. I trust everything was as I described.
See the missile battery for yourself. My information is fully accurate.
I can tell you all about Gearbox, the Empire and their activities. But before I help you, you must help me. I want protection for my wife and daughter.
What are you talking about?
I can't help you until I know your intel is good.
Not so fast.
And I cannot help you until I know that my family is safe.
It's yourself that you need to be worried about, unless you start talking.
I don't think so. [Hit Markus.]
Beating me will not earn you the information you seek; your friends in House Organa have already tried.
My wife and daughter. They still live amongst my house--and amongst the Imperials.
If I tell you what I know, they will suffer for that betrayal. I won't allow this. So, until my family is safe, I can tell you nothing.
Lead me to Gearbox, and I'll do whatever you want.
I have a mission to complete.
If I tell you where he is now, you could simply deal with him and leave--gaining me nothing.
Your family isn't my problem.
You're wasting my time.
I understand that. Which is why I cannot trust you to rescue them once I've revealed what I know.
You can talk--and you will.
I'll break you. [Hit Markus.]
This does not help your mission. If you care at all about finding Gearbox, you will consider what I'm saying.
Perhaps a compromise: I tell you part of what I know, to prove the veracity of my claims.
If you find that my intelligence is accurate, you help my family, after which I will tell you exactly how to locate Gearbox.
Let's hear this intel of yours.
Sounds fair enough.
I'll hear you out, Thul. But this better be good.
You're pushing me.
Forget it.
I doubt you will feel that way once you hear what I have to tell you.
Among other projects, Gearbox has helped construct a hidden, highly sophisticated missile battery capable of eradicating any Organa force that approaches Thul territory.
Destroying this missile battery would greatly benefit your Organa allies--and prove how accurate my information is. All you need do for the rest is protect my wife and daughter.
We'll talk after I'm done checking your intel. If you're telling the truth, then I'll protect your family.
I'll look into this.
Then you will have what you seek.
Your intel better check out.
I'm not. You'll see.
Farewell.
It's been a pleasure, Markus.
Thanks! [Hit Markus.]
Ungh... likewise.
So--a visitor. Welcome. I am Markus Andarius Thul.
Your aspect and equipment are not those of House Organa. Whom do you represent?
I'm with Republic Special Forces.
SpecForce.
Just as I'd hoped. We have much to discuss.
If you cooperate, I can make life much easier for you.
People who can help you.
Ah. So my offer of information has finally reached the correct persons.
Instead of my friends, let's talk about yours--like Gearbox.
I'll ask the questions here.
A soldier, clearly. And not of House Organa. But someone Organa allows to speak with their prisoners--someone from the Republic.
Ask any questions you wish. The answers will only come when you've done what I require.
I have nothing to discuss with you.
Valyn is unharmed, though I fear I will soon expire due to my injuries.
Don't be foolish, mum, you're barely hurt. A few hours in a kolto tank and you'll look better than ever!
I'm fine, my dear--it is your precious daughter whose life was almost taken due to this fool's negligence.
It's nothing, mum--truly! The scars will serve as eternal monuments to our heroic journey.
I'm honestly shocked that we weren't killed outright. This fool did little to ensure our safety.
We are fortunate even to be breathing, my dear. Our grievous wounds may prove fatal at any moment.
Mum, you're so dramatic. We were wounded in battle, Father, just like the true heroes of legend!
